### Notation

- Scalars: lower-case letters \\(v,m\\)
- Vectors: boldface lower-case letters \\(\mathbf{v}\\)
- Matrices: boldface capital letters \\(\mathbf{M}\\)

TODO: staged?

- \\(i\\)th element of a vector \\(\mathbf{v}\\): \\(v_i\\) <!-- .element: class="fragment" data-fragment-index="1" -->
- \\((i,j)\\)-element of a matrix \\(\mathbf{M}\\): \\(m_{ij}\\) <!-- .element: class="fragment" data-fragment-index="2" -->
- \\(i\\)th row of a matrix \\(\mathbf{M}\\): \\(\mathbf{m}_{i:}\\) <!-- .element: class="fragment" data-fragment-index="3" -->
- \\(j\\)th column of a matrix \\(\mathbf{M}\\): \\(\mathbf{m}_{:j}\\) <!-- .element: class="fragment" data-fragment-index="4" -->

### Matrix Operations
- the **inner product** is \\(\langle u,v \rangle := \sum_{l=1}^L u_{l} v_l\\)
where \\(u\in\Re^L\\) and \\(v\in\Re^L\\)
- the **outer product**  \\( u \otimes v \\) between vectors \\(u\in\Re^n\\) and \\(v\in\Re^m\\) is the \\(n\times m\\) matrix with elements \\(u_iv_j\\), \\( i=\{1,\cdots,n\} \\) and \\(j= \{1,\cdots,n\} \\).
- for matrices \\(\mathbf{U} \in\Re^{n\times L} \\) and \\(\mathbf{V} \in \Re^{L \times m} \\), \\( \mathbf{U} \otimes \mathbf{V} := \sum_{\ell=1}^L \mathbf{U}_{:\ell} \otimes \mathbf{V}_{\ell:} \\)

### References 
- Kolda, Tamara G., and Brett W. Bader. "Tensor decompositions and applications." SIAM review 51.3 (2009): 455-500.
- Goldberg, Andrew B., Zhu, Xiaojin, Recht, Benjamin, Xu, Jun-Ming, Nowak, Robert. "Transduction with Matrix Completion: Three Birds with One Stone." In Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems (NIPS) 24. 2010.
